title: Tesla Board Explores New Executive Compensation Amid Production Acceleration and Tariff Adjustments
content:
### Board Considers New Compensation Plan for CEO

Tesla's board is reportedly exploring a new compensation package for CEO Elon Musk, according to the [Financial Times](https://www.ft.com/). This move comes as the company awaits a court ruling on the reinstatement of Musk's 2018 pay package. A special committee of the board, composed of Chair Robyn Denholm and independent director Kathleen Wilson-Thompson, is reviewing the compensation and considering alternative forms of remuneration if the original package is not reinstated by the Delaware Supreme Court., Tesla had previously disclosed the formation of a special committee to consider compensation matters involving Mr. Musk in a regulatory filing last month. The company has also delayed its annual shareholder meeting, which is typically preceded by the filing of its annual proxy statement, to allow more time for the committee's work.,

The 2018 compensation package, valued at approximately $56 billion at the time and now significantly higher, was voided by a Delaware court in 2024, which cited flaws in the board's approval process and a lack of fairness to shareholders., Musk initiated an appeal against this ruling in March, arguing the lower court judge made legal errors., If the original package is reinstated, it would increase Musk's ownership stake in Tesla from around 12% to over 20%. Any new compensation agreement is expected to tie stock options to specific financial, operational, and share price targets., The consideration of a new package suggests that Tesla may be anticipating that the original 2018 compensation might not be fully reinstated.

The discussion around Musk's compensation occurs at a time when Tesla is undergoing a strategic shift, focusing more on robotaxis and humanoid robots rather than solely being an automaker., This pivot positions Tesla more as an AI and robotics company., Musk, as the largest shareholder, stands to gain significantly from the company's success. However, he does not receive a salary for his CEO role. The compensation debate highlights the complexities of aligning executive pay with shareholder value during a period of significant strategic transformation and ongoing legal challenges. Separately, board chair Robyn Denholm has sold a considerable amount of Tesla stock, totaling over $530 million since 2018, with more than half of that occurring in the first four months of this year.,, These sales were conducted through a pre-arranged selling plan.

### Production and Supply Chain Adjustments Underway

Tesla is set to resume shipping components from China to the United States for the production of its Cybercab and Semi trucks, a move following a recent tariff agreement between the U.S. and China.,, This resumption, expected by the end of May 2025, comes after Tesla had previously paused such shipments due to the imposition of 145% tariffs on Chinese imports by the Trump administration., The negotiated compromise reportedly reduces these tariffs to 30%. Trial production for the Cybercab and Semi is targeted for October, with ambitions for mass production in 2026., The Cybercab is planned for manufacturing at Gigafactory Texas, while the Semi truck production is slated for a new facility near Gigafactory Nevada., Tesla has been increasing its workforce in Nevada to support the goal of reaching 50,000 units of annual Semi production by the end of 2025.

The easing of trade tensions and the resumption of component shipments from China are seen as crucial for Tesla to meet its production milestones for these upcoming vehicles. Tesla's CFO, Vaibhav Taneja, had previously indicated that tariffs had created barriers to capital investments and delayed expansion efforts. This strategic shift to leverage its global supply chain underscores Tesla's adaptability in navigating the complex international trade landscape., While the recent tariff truce provides a window for optimizing costs and accelerating production, the potential for future policy shifts highlights the continued uncertainty in the trade environment. Alongside these developments, Tesla's Shanghai Gigafactory reportedly completed the capacity ramp-up for the updated Model Y in six weeks, setting a new record for the company. April 2025 exports from the Shanghai facility saw a significant surge compared to March, indicating a focus on global markets.

In parallel with production planning, Tesla is actively constructing a new supercomputer facility, designated as Cortex 2.0, at Gigafactory Texas., This facility is being rapidly built, with steel assembly underway and permits secured for various aspects of the structure. Cortex 2.0 is intended to be a companion to the existing Cortex supercluster at the site and is expected to accelerate Tesla's work on its Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology. The company aims to begin testing its robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, in June. This development aligns with Tesla's broader strategic shift towards becoming an AI and robotics company.,

### Market Sentiment and Technical Indicators

Tesla shares have experienced a notable rally, rising for a sixth consecutive day as of Wednesday, May 14, 2025., This recent surge has significantly reduced the stock's year-to-date loss., The rally has been attributed in part to the easing of U.S.-China trade tensions and the company's focus on its robotaxi program., However, some market watchers are pointing to technical indicators that suggest the stock may be approaching a point where a pullback could occur.,

According to Matthew Unterman, managing director at research firm S3 Partners, Tesla's stock is showing "overbought technicals". The stock's Relative Strength Index (RSI) has exceeded 70, which is often interpreted by momentum traders as a sign that a stock has risen too quickly. The last time Tesla's RSI was above 70 was in December 2024, which preceded a significant decline in the stock price. Other technical signals, such as the stock climbing above the upper Bollinger band, also suggest that aggressive buying has driven the price higher., While short interest in Tesla has remained relatively stable, a notable increase could contribute to selling pressure., Despite these technical signals, some analysts maintain a bullish long-term outlook for Tesla, citing the potential of its FSD and robotaxi businesses. However, other analyses suggest that the stock remains overvalued based on fundamentals.

title: Tesla Navigates Global Headwinds and Compensation Discussions.
content:
### Sales Performance and Market Challenges

Tesla has faced significant challenges in key global markets, particularly in China, with a notable drop in deliveries. According to [Electrek](https://electrek.co/2025/05/13/tesla-tsla-chinese-deliveries-dropped-scary-low-level/), based on insurance registration data, Tesla delivered only 3,070 vehicles in China last week, marking a 69% decrease from the same week last year. Overall 2025 deliveries in China are reportedly down compared to the same period in 2024. [Electrek](https://electrek.co/2025/05/13/tesla-tsla-chinese-deliveries-dropped-scary-low-level/) notes that this decline occurred despite a ramp-up in production of the updated Model Y at Gigafactory Shanghai. The report suggests that demand for the updated Model Y may be lower than anticipated.

**The challenging sales trend extends beyond China. According to [BuyaCar](https**//www.buyacar.co.uk/tesla/tesla-statistics), Tesla's global sales fell by 13% year-on-year in the first quarter of 2025. This follows a tough 2024 where the company missed its annual sales growth target [BNN Bloomberg](https://www.bnnbloomberg.ca/tesla-signals-caution-says-it-will-revisit-2025-growth-outlook-1.2062402). Data from Australia also showed a substantial decline in April sales, with deliveries down 75% compared to the previous year, impacting both Model Y and Model 3 sales [The Driven](https://thedriven.io/2025/05/05/tesla-sales-plunge-again-in-april-down-stunning-75-pct-over-year-before/). This decrease in Australia is attributed to factors including consumers awaiting the refreshed Model Y and potential consumer pushback related to Elon Musk's political activities [The Driven](https://thedriven.io/2025/05/05/tesla-sales-plunge-again-in-april-down-stunning-75-pct-over-year-before/). European markets have also seen declining sales in the opening months of 2025, with significant drops in France, Sweden, and Denmark in April [BuyaCar](https://www.buyacar.co.uk/tesla/tesla-statistics).

Competition in the EV market is intensifying, contributing to pricing pressures and impacting sales. [The Motley Fool](https://www.motleyfool.com/investing/2025/05/13/should-you-buy-tesla-stock-with-1000-and-hold-for-20-years/) highlights that lower selling prices due to competitive forces impacted Tesla's operating income, which reportedly tanked by 66% in Q1. While Tesla has extended its 0% financing offer in China through June 30 to stimulate sales, the current delivery levels are described as not sustainable [Electrek](https://electrek.co/2025/05/13/tesla-tsla-chinese-deliveries-dropped-scary-low-level/). [BNN Bloomberg](https://www.bnnbloomberg.ca/tesla-signals-caution-says-it-will-revisit-2025-growth-outlook-1.2062402) reports that Tesla stated in its Q1 earnings release that it is "making prudent investments that will set up" the vehicle business for growth, but this will depend on factors including production increases and the broader macroeconomic environment.

### Executive Compensation and Board Review

Tesla's board of directors has established a special committee to evaluate CEO Elon Musk's compensation, according to multiple reports. [Morningstar](https://www.morningstar.com/news/dow-jones/20250514/elon-musk-pay-talks-at-tesla-present-dilemma-given-automakers-premium-and-his-controversial-profile) and [Teslarati](https://www.teslarati.com/elon-musk-56b-pay-package-tesla-committee-review/) state that the committee, comprising Chairperson Robyn Denholm and independent director Kathleen Wilson-Thompson, is tasked with reviewing Musk's pay package and exploring alternative compensation methods if his 2018 pay deal is not reinstated. The 2018 compensation package, valued at $56 billion at the time, was blocked by a Delaware court, a decision Tesla is appealing to the Delaware Supreme Court [Morningstar](https://www.morningstar.com/news/dow-jones/20250514/elon-musk-pay-talks-at-tesla-present-dilemma-given-automakers-premium-and-his-controversial-profile).

**According to [Business Standard](https**//www.business-standard.com/world-news/tesla-eyes-new-pay-deal-for-musk-as-legal-row-over-56-bn-package-drags-on-125051400053_1.html), the newly formed compensation committee has hired McDermott Will & Emery, a law firm with expertise in Texan corporate law, replacing its former Delaware-based counsel. Any new pay structure is expected to link stock options to financial, operational, and share price targets [Business Standard](https://www.business-standard.com/world-news/tesla-eyes-new-pay-deal-for-musk-as-legal-row-over-56-bn-package-drags-on-125051400053_1.html), [Teslarati](https://www.teslarati.com/elon-musk-56b-pay-package-tesla-committee-review/). [Business Standard](https://www.business-standard.com/world-news/tesla-eyes-new-pay-deal-for-musk-as-legal-row-over-56-bn-package-drags-on-125051400053_1.html) also notes that if the previous options were reinstated, it would trigger a significant accounting charge and taxes for Musk, as the company has already surpassed the performance metrics tied to the original package. The disclosure of this special committee in a regulatory filing prompted major shareholders to share their views on Musk's pay and continued leadership [Business Standard](https://www.business-standard.com/world-news/tesla-eyes-new-pay-deal-for-musk-as-legal-row-over-56-bn-package-drags-on-125051400053_1.html). Tesla has delayed its annual shareholder meeting to allow more time for the committee's work [Business Standard](https://www.business-standard.com/world-news/tesla-eyes-new-pay-deal-for-musk-as-legal-row-over-56-bn-package-drags-on-1.html).

The discussions around Musk's compensation occur as his public profile and political alignment have reportedly become a liability for Tesla, with electric vehicle sales falling in the US and Europe and slowing in China [Business Standard](https://www.business-standard.com/world-news/tesla-eyes-new-pay-deal-for-musk-as-legal-row-over-56-bn-package-drags-on-125051400053_1.html). Despite this, [Morningstar](https://www.morningstar.com/news/dow-jones/20250514/elon-musk-pay-talks-at-tesla-present-dilemma-given-automakers-premium-and-his-controversial-profile) suggests that unseating Musk could have painful short-term repercussions for the share price due to his inextricable link with the company's fortunes.

### Production and Future Projects

Amidst the sales challenges, Tesla is moving forward with plans for new models and initiatives. According to [Reuters](https://cnevpost.com/2025/05/14/tesla-resume-shipping-parts-china-us-cybercab-semi/), Tesla plans to resume shipping parts from China to the US for the production of Cybercab and Semi trucks from the end of May. This move follows a de-escalation of the US-China trade war and a truce that agreed to eliminate most additional tariffs and countermeasures [Reuters](https://cnevpost.com/2025/05/14/tesla-resume-shipping-parts-china-us-cybercab-semi/), [GuruFocus](https://www.gurufocus.com/news/2635360/tesla-tsla-stock-rises-amid-renewed-chinaus-trade-developments). Tesla had previously suspended plans to ship these parts after tariffs were raised [Reuters](https://cnevpost.com/2025/05/14/tesla-resume-shipping-parts-china-us-cybercab-semi/). Trial production for both the Cybercab and Semi is planned for October, with mass production expected in 2026 [Reuters](https://cnevpost.com/2025/05/14/tesla-resume-shipping-parts-china-us-cybercab-semi/). The Cybercab will reportedly be built in Texas and the Semi in Nevada [Reuters](https://cnevpost.com/2025/05/14/tesla-resume-shipping-parts-china-us-cybercab-semi/).

Tesla is also continuing development of its Optimus humanoid robot. According to [Teslarati](https://www.teslarati.com/tesla-recruits-data-collection-operators-optimus-bot-development/), the company is recruiting Data Collection Operators to support the Optimus development team by gathering data, addressing engineering requests, and providing equipment feedback. [Teslarati](https://www.teslarati.com/tesla-recruits-data-collection-operators-optimus-bot-development/) also highlights recent advancements showcased by Elon Musk, including a video of Optimus dancing with improved flexibility.

Despite a difficult start to 2025 with a significant drop in share price, Tesla's stock has seen a recent surge in May [Simply Wall St](https://simplywall.st/stocks/us/automotive/nasdaq-tsla/tesla/news/teslanasdaqtsla-q1-2025-earnings-reveal-decline-in-sales-and-n), [Tesla stock is up 18% in May and 40% since April 22, despite dropping 15.44% since January; CEO Elon Musk's pledge to focus more on Tesla and less on White House duties has boosted investor confidence; Tesla plans to launch a self-driving robotaxi service in Austin in June and a lower-priced model mid-year; Analyst price targets vary widely from $115 to $450, with a consensus median of $284.23; Tesla's board is exploring a new compensation package for Musk, following his contested 2018 options worth about $90 billion. (2025-05-14)]. This rebound is attributed in part to an easing of trade tensions with China and Elon Musk's stated intention to focus more on Tesla [The Motley Fool](https://www.motleyfool.com/investing/2025/05/13/why-tesla-stock-jumped-today-even-as-sales-continue-to-plunge/), [Tesla stock is up 18% in May and 40% since April 22, despite dropping 15.44% since January; CEO Elon Musk's pledge to focus more on Tesla and less on White House duties has boosted investor confidence; Tesla plans to launch a self-driving robotaxi service in Austin in June and a lower-priced model mid-year; Analyst price targets vary widely from $115 to $450, with a consensus median of $284.23; Tesla's board is exploring a new compensation package for Musk, following his contested 2018 options worth about $90 billion. (2025-05-14)]. The company's plans for a robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, expected to launch in June, are also contributing to investor optimism [Tesla stock is up 18% in May and 40% since April 22, despite dropping 15.44% since January; CEO Elon Musk's pledge to focus more on Tesla and less on White House duties has boosted investor confidence; Tesla plans to launch a self-driving robotaxi service in Austin in June and a lower-priced model mid-year; Analyst price targets vary widely from $115 to $450, with a consensus median of $284.23; Tesla's board is exploring a new compensation package for Musk, following his contested 2018 options worth about $90 billion. (2025-05-14)]. Regulatory bodies, however, are seeking more information regarding the technology and plans for public road use of these autonomous vehicles [CFO Dive](https://www.cfodive.com/news/tesla-cfo-offloads-another-11m-in-stock/716079/).

title: Tesla Stock Surges Amid Trade Optimism and Robotaxi Scrutiny.
content:
### Market Performance and Trade Developments

Tesla's stock has seen significant gains, pushing its market capitalization back above $1 trillion on Monday, May 12. This surge is occurring during a broader market rally influenced by the temporary agreement between the United States and China to lower tariffs for 90 days.,, According to Investopedia, shares of Tesla rose nearly 7% on Monday, closing at $318.38 and bringing the company's market cap to $1.02 trillion. This makes Tesla one of nine American companies valued at $1 trillion or more. The stock's performance comes after three consecutive weeks of gains, although shares remain down more than 20% year-to-date. The recent upward trend follows CEO Elon Musk's statement during the first quarter earnings call that he would dedicate more time to Tesla, as well as the news of a potential trade agreement.

The temporary tariff reduction between the U.S. and China involves the U.S. cutting tariffs on Chinese imports to 30% from 145%, and China reducing tariffs on U.S. imports to 10% from 125%. Morningstar noted that this temporary pause could benefit Tesla by lowering tariff-related inflation, although they maintain a fair value estimate of $250 for the stock, viewing current prices as overvalued., Despite the recent stock rally, concerns about sales performance persist, particularly in China and Europe., According to Electrek, Tesla's sales and exports in China slowed in April, with sales down 8.6% year-on-year and exports down 3.3% year-on-year. CnEVPost reported that domestic sales in China were down 8.56% in April compared to the same month last year. European sales have also reportedly continued to decline, with a significant drop in the first quarter of 2025.

### Regulatory Scrutiny on Robotaxi Plans

Tesla's plans for its robotaxi service are facing increased scrutiny from U.S. safety regulators. The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) has requested detailed information regarding Tesla's planned robotaxi deployment in Austin, Texas, which CEO Elon Musk announced would be unveiled in August., According to Teslarati, the NHTSA sent a letter to Tesla's Field Quality Director seeking more information on how the company's system will perform in reduced visibility conditions and how it plans to evaluate its vehicles and driving automation technologies for public roads. AV America reported that this inquiry is part of a broader investigation into Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) software, particularly its performance in low-visibility conditions such as sun glare, fog, airborne dust, rain, or snow.,

The NHTSA's investigation into Tesla's FSD technology was initiated in October 2023 following reports of crashes, including two fatalities. Regulators are seeking details on how Tesla intends to manage emergency scenarios during robotaxi operations and whether vehicles will have real-time remote supervision., They also requested technical specifications for sensors and cameras and confirmation of whether Tesla's systems comply with industry standards for autonomous driving technology., This intensified scrutiny comes as Tesla aims to launch its robotaxi service in June, according to some reports, and as the company is increasingly relying on autonomous technology as a future revenue stream.,

### Employee Sentiment and Optimus Development

Amidst the company's performance and regulatory challenges, a group of current and former Tesla employees has publicly called for CEO Elon Musk to resign.,, Organized under the banner "Tesla Employees for a New Chapter," they published an open letter expressing concerns about the company's direction and attributing recent sales declines, in part, to Musk's public activities and involvement in the Trump administration., According to Gravity ETC, the letter states that the damage to Musk's personal brand has become a burden for Tesla and that the company is at a crossroads. One former employee, a staff program manager, claimed he was fired after creating a website urging Musk to step down.

In other developments, Tesla continues to showcase progress on its Optimus humanoid robot. Elon Musk shared a video on May 13, 2025, which he stated showed a real Optimus robot dancing in real-time. According to NDTV, the video features the robot moving with notable fluidity. This follows previous demonstrations of Optimus performing tasks and updates on its walking capabilities. Last month, Musk had mentioned that Optimus production had been affected by China's export restrictions on rare earth magnets, which are crucial for the robot's development. He clarified that Tesla's use of these magnets is solely for the humanoid robots. Separately, Teslarati reported that Tesla is constructing a facility at Gigafactory Texas designated as Cortex 2.0, which is believed to be related to the company's supercomputing efforts.

### Production and Market Position

Tesla's Shanghai Gigafactory has completed the capacity ramp-up for the updated Model Y in just six weeks, a record for the company., According to CnEVPost, Tesla shared this information, stating that factories are the company's best products. The ramped-up production at Giga Shanghai is expected to allow for the production of over 60,000 Model Y vehicles per month. This is seen as essential for meeting demand in both local and export markets. The updated Model Y became available in China in January, with production starting in February and deliveries beginning later that month. Despite the production ramp, Tesla's sales in China saw a year-over-year decline in April.,

While Tesla has made the 2025 Model Y more affordable in some instances, the company faces increasing competition in the EV market globally. Established automakers and new entrants are investing heavily in EV production, which could pressure Tesla's market share and pricing strategies. Reports indicate that Tesla's sales have lagged in various markets, contributing to the company's first sales decline in over a decade in 2024, and an accelerated decline in early 2025., Despite these challenges, Tesla's stock has recently seen a rally, with some analysts pointing to technical indicators suggesting potential for growth, while also noting the risks associated with competition and leadership challenges. Morningstar maintains a view that Tesla's current model lineup may be nearing market saturation, and they do not anticipate significant delivery volume from a more affordable vehicle until 2026.,

### India Market Entry Explored

Tesla is reportedly exploring land in Satara, Maharashtra, India, to establish a Completely Knocked Down (CKD) assembly unit. According to Angel One, this move is part of Tesla's plans to begin local EV assembly and enter the Indian market by 2026. A CKD unit involves importing vehicles in parts for local assembly, which can help reduce import duties and aligns with India's focus on local manufacturing. The report indicates that Tesla aims for a formal entry into the Indian market by April 2026 and has started hiring for various positions across India. This follows discussions with Indian firms for potential CKD partnerships and Elon Musk's meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. News reports also suggest that Tesla has leased its first showroom space in Mumbai, which is expected to handle imported EV sales.

Organized under the banner "Tesla Employees for a New Chapter," they published an open letter expressing concerns about the company's direction and attributing recent sales declines, in part, to Musk's public activities and involvement in the Trump administration.
According to Gravity ETC, the letter states that the damage to Musk's personal brand has become a burden for Tesla and that the company is at a crossroads.
One former employee, a staff program manager, claimed he was fired after creating a website urging Musk to step down.
Elon Musk shared a video on May 13, 2025, which he stated showed a real Optimus robot dancing in real-time.
According to NDTV, the video features the robot moving with notable fluidity.
This follows previous demonstrations of Optimus performing tasks and updates on its walking capabilities.
Last month, Musk had mentioned that Optimus production had been affected by China's export restrictions on rare earth magnets, which are crucial for the robot's development.
He clarified that Tesla's use of these magnets is solely for the humanoid robots.
Separately, Teslarati reported that Tesla is constructing a facility at Gigafactory Texas designated as Cortex 2.0, which is believed to be related to the company's supercomputing efforts.
Tesla's Shanghai Gigafactory has completed the capacity ramp-up for the updated Model Y in just six weeks, a record for the company.
According to CnEVPost, Tesla shared this information, stating that factories are the company's best products.
The ramped-up production at Giga Shanghai is expected to allow for the production of over 60,000 Model Y vehicles per month.
This is seen as essential for meeting demand in both local and export markets.
The updated Model Y became available in China in January, with production starting in February and deliveries beginning later that month.
Despite the production ramp, Tesla's sales in China saw a year-over-year decline in April.
While Tesla has made the 2025 Model Y more affordable in some instances, the company faces increasing competition in the EV market globally.
Established automakers and new entrants are investing heavily in EV production, which could pressure Tesla's market share and pricing strategies.
Reports indicate that Tesla's sales have lagged in various markets, contributing to the company's first sales decline in over a decade in 2024, and an accelerated decline in early 2025.

Despite these challenges, Tesla's stock has recently seen a rally, with some analysts pointing to technical indicators suggesting potential for growth, while also noting the risks associated with competition and leadership challenges.
Morningstar maintains a view that Tesla's current model lineup may be nearing market saturation, and they do not anticipate significant delivery volume from a more affordable vehicle until 2026.
Tesla is reportedly exploring land in Satara, Maharashtra, India, to establish a Completely Knocked Down (CKD) assembly unit.
According to Angel One, this move is part of Tesla's plans to begin local EV assembly and enter the Indian market by 2026.
A CKD unit involves importing vehicles in parts for local assembly, which can help reduce import duties and aligns with India's focus on local manufacturing.
The report indicates that Tesla aims for a formal entry into the Indian market by April 2026 and has started hiring for various positions across India.
This follows discussions with Indian firms for potential CKD partnerships and Elon Musk's meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
News reports also suggest that Tesla has leased its first showroom space in Mumbai, which is expected to handle imported EV sales.

title: Tesla Stock Surges Amid Trade Optimism and Insider Activity, While Production and Regulatory Matters Remain Key Factors.
content:
### Market Performance and Influences

Tesla's stock has experienced a notable surge, reaching its highest closing level in over two months and marking its third consecutive week of gains. As of May 12, 2025, shares gained nearly 5% on Friday, closing around $298. Premarket trading on Monday saw an even sharper increase, with shares adding 7.6%, influenced by news of a U.S.-China trade deal. This agreement involves a temporary reduction in reciprocal tariffs between the two countries for 90 days. According to Reuters, U.S. stock index futures jumped following this development, signaling a de-escalation in trade tensions. This trade news is expected to significantly influence market sentiment this week.

Contributing to the positive market activity was an insider stock purchase by Tesla director Joseph Gebbia on April 24, 2025. Gebbia acquired $1 million worth of stock at an average price of $256.31 per share. As of May 12, 2025, this investment had gained over $200,000, with the stock price rallying to $311.05 by press time, a 21.36% increase since his purchase. This marked the first such insider buy in over five years, according to Finbold. Beyond trade developments and insider activity, Tesla's stock performance is also being viewed through a technical analysis lens, with key overhead resistance areas identified around $360 and $430, and support levels near $289 and $225, according to TradingView.com analysis published by Investopedia.

### Production and Gigafactory Updates

At Gigafactory Texas, apparent castings for the upcoming Cybercab robotaxi have been observed accumulating. These castings are reportedly different from those used for the Model Y and Cybertruck currently produced at the facility, leading to speculation about preparations for Cybercab volume production, which Tesla has stated is planned for next year. According to Teslarati, recent aerial images captured by a Giga Texas observer show a growing number of these distinct castings. Tesla has indicated that the Cybercab production line will resemble a high-speed consumer electronics line with the goal of reaching a production rate of approximately 2 million vehicles per year. Additionally, new parts for a Gigapress, used for creating these large castings, have also been sighted at Giga Texas, potentially indicating a new assembly line or modifications to an existing one, according to Not a Tesla App.

Meanwhile, Gigafactory Berlin recently reached a significant milestone, producing its 500,000th Model Y. This achievement comes approximately three years after the factory's official opening. Tesla plans to further expand the Berlin facility with the long-term goal of exceeding an annual production capacity of 1 million vehicles. Despite this production milestone and the introduction of the refreshed Model Y in Europe earlier this year, Tesla's sales in several major European markets experienced significant declines in April. According to BNN Bloomberg, registrations in the U.K. were down 62% year-over-year, with even more pronounced drops in Denmark, the Netherlands, and Sweden. This sales slump in Europe follows production line changeovers for the refreshed Model Y globally, which impacted output earlier in the year.

### Regulatory Environment and Future Products

The regulatory landscape for autonomous driving continues to evolve, with implications for Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology and future products like the Cybercab. According to Sustainability Times, recent layoffs of autonomous vehicle experts at the National Highway Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) initiated by Elon Musk have raised concerns about the agency's capacity to regulate emerging self-driving technologies. This development occurs as Tesla navigates ongoing regulatory investigations and seeks approvals for its autonomous projects.

In the realm of FSD development, Elon Musk has suggested potential new names for the "Hurry" mode within the FSD system, including "Move It" and "LFGMF," with the latter reportedly favored in a poll among FSD beta testers. This follows a previous renaming of the mode from "Assertive" to "Hurry." On the product front, while sightings of potential Cybercab castings at Giga Texas suggest progress, Tesla's plan to launch unsupervised FSD rides in Austin, Texas, in June is expected to utilize Model Y vehicles with unsupervised autonomy rather than the Cybercab itself. Alphabet's Waymo also exploring the possibility of personal ownership of robotaxis and licensing to other automakers is seen as a potential validation of Tesla's own autonomous vehicle strategy, according to The Motley Fool. Despite this, some internal critics at Tesla reportedly believe that a lack of regulatory expertise could hinder the deployment of autonomous vehicles like the Robotaxi and Cybercab.

### Other Developments

In India, Tesla is reportedly planning to establish an electric vehicle assembly plant in Satara, Maharashtra. This facility is expected to operate as a completely knocked down (CKD) unit, allowing Tesla to import parts for local assembly and potentially benefit from lower import duties. This move aligns with India's policy encouraging foreign automakers to invest in local production in exchange for reduced import tariffs. Separately, Tesla has reportedly canceled the planned range extender battery for the Cybertruck and is issuing refunds to customers who placed orders. According to a Giga Texas update on YouTube, the range extender had been experiencing delays and was recently removed from the design studio, suggesting the product was not viable or required significant further engineering.

title: Tesla Faces Production Adjustments and External Pressures Amidst Strategic Shifts
content:
### Production Adjustments and Inventory Concerns

Tesla has reportedly instructed hourly workers on the Model Y and Cybertruck production lines at its Austin, Texas factory to stay home for a week during the U.S. Memorial Day holiday, an extended break compared to the previous year when these lines operated normally. Since February, employees have observed increasingly inconsistent production schedules, often being sent home early, and overtime has been reduced with warnings of disciplinary action for working extra hours. Reports from last month indicated that Tesla had lowered its production targets for the Cybertruck and reassigned some workers from the production line. This comes after Tesla's first-quarter deliveries dropped 13% year-over-year, with production exceeding deliveries by nearly 26,000 vehicles, despite a production decrease of approximately 100,000 compared to the previous quarter. According to a Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification from the Texas Workforce Commission, contractor Trigo also dismissed 50 employees at the Austin plant earlier this month.

This production slowdown at the Austin plant occurs amidst broader inventory concerns and a challenging market environment. Tesla's first-quarter net income plunged 71% to $409 million, with core automotive revenue tumbling 20% to $14 billion. The company produced nearly 26,000 more vehicles than it delivered in the first quarter. The Cybertruck, in particular, has faced challenges, with reports suggesting over 10,000 units remain unsold, and fewer than 50,000 units delivered as of March, according to a voluntary recall notice. In an effort to stimulate demand, Tesla introduced discounts on the refreshed Model Y launched in January and released a cheaper variant this week.

### Gigafactory Shanghai Model Y Production Ramps Up

In contrast to the adjustments in Austin, Tesla's Gigafactory Shanghai has completed the production ramp-up of the updated Model Y in just six weeks, which the company states is its fastest model production speed on record. This ramped-up production is expected to allow the Shanghai plant to produce over 60,000 Model Y vehicles per month, or about 15,000 per week. This achievement highlights Tesla's manufacturing capabilities, particularly in Shanghai, which is described as the world's most productive car factory. The rapid scale-up is attributed to refined production processes, enhanced automation, and lessons learned from previous production challenges.

The increased production capacity in Shanghai is significant as the plant produces all Australian-bound Teslas, with thousands of deliveries of the new Model Y having recently commenced there. Despite the production ramp-up, Tesla's deliveries in China have been declining, according to insurance registration data. This decline is occurring amidst increased competition from Chinese EV manufacturers offering vehicles at competitive prices and a preference among some Chinese buyers for domestic brands, partly influenced by the trade war with the U.S. Tesla is attempting to counter this sentiment by emphasizing that its vehicles sold in China are "Made in China."

### Robotaxi and AI Development

Tesla continues to focus on its autonomous driving technology and the planned robotaxi service. CEO Elon Musk has stated the company is focused on bringing robotaxi to Austin in June. However, the company has encountered obstacles with trademark applications for "Robotaxi" and "Cybercab." The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) has issued a "nonfinal office action" regarding the "Robotaxi" application, stating the name is too generic, requiring a response from Tesla within three months to avoid the application being discarded. The "Cybercab" trademark application has also been suspended due to similar terms being pursued by other firms.

Concurrently, Tesla is highlighting its advancements in artificial intelligence, particularly with its Dojo supercomputer and Optimus humanoid robot. According to technology analyst Enrique Abeyta, Dojo represents a move towards an AI infrastructure independent of traditional chipmakers and cloud platforms, born out of the necessity to meet Tesla's AI training needs amidst high demand and delays for chips from companies like Nvidia. Dojo is currently used to train on 160 billion frames of video daily from vehicles globally. Musk has indicated the potential to offer Dojo as a sellable service to other companies, similar to Amazon Web Services. Regarding the Optimus robot, Musk has previously stated a projected retail price potentially as low as $10,000 to $20,000 once scaled. Leveraging components from its EVs, such as batteries and actuators, is seen as a way to build the robot at a lower cost.

### Market and Financial Headwinds

Tesla's financial performance in the first quarter of 2025 showed a significant drop in net income and automotive revenue, contributing to investor concerns. The company's stock has experienced volatility and is down about 26% year-to-date. A U.S. pension fund, the Lehigh County Pension Board in Pennsylvania, has paused new investments in Tesla stock, citing concerns over CEO Elon Musk's behavior and the company's weakening financial performance, including the 71% drop in net income and shrinking market share in key regions like California. According to the California New Car Dealers Association, Tesla's EV registrations in California dropped 15% year-over-year, while other zero-emission vehicle brands saw a 35% increase, leading to Tesla's market share in the state falling from 55.5% to 43.9%.

Macroeconomic factors, including global tariffs and changing political sentiment, are also impacting Tesla. While Tesla's localized manufacturing in its gigafactories in the U.S., Europe, and China offers some protection from a global trade war, the company is exposed to tariffs in its supply chain and on certain models. The company has noted that shifting global trade policy can impact automotive and energy supply chains, cost structure, and demand. Government incentives for EV adoption, such as the U.S. $7,500 EV tax credit, also face uncertainty. Beyond tariffs, some countries' governments and consumers have reportedly become more skeptical of Tesla due to Musk's political ties and public statements, potentially impacting demand. Despite these challenges, Tesla's stock has seen some recent gains, aligning with a broader recovery in megacap technology stocks fueled by strong first-quarter earnings from tech companies and potential de-escalation in trade tensions.

title: Tesla Stock Rises Amid Trade Optimism and Production Milestones
content:
### Stock Performance and Market Factors

Tesla's stock experienced a notable increase on Friday, continuing a trend from the previous day. Shares were up nearly 7% in recent trading, reaching $303.75, their highest point since February, and are on track for a third consecutive week of gains, according to [Investopedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHpLOrkLW7iIVULInrjCqzY-17lxw4A6zSHo7DyDFxF-kBtC2NWcNKczBtTm1QnuxSVdghgJryKR65ycphymUOvPVrfN9i8ZW_O-J6vTVS4Sk2b6Da99BsymNEnMpkWb49SuWwv9jumBd6AfrZ4BboXRH7II9mk1IZjPEybGmsxyISN6UBzy2c6N-0kLq2ChsvQSbX9csKsub-J4-JIZg==). This surge occurred amidst broader market gains, partly fueled by optimism surrounding potential trade deals. [Investopedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHpLOrkLW7iIVULInrjCqzY-17lxw4A6zSHo7DyDFxF-kBtC2NWcNKczBtTm1QnuxSVdghgJryKR65ycphymUOvPVrfN9i8ZW_O-J6vTVS4Sk2b6Da99BsymNEnMpkWb49Suwsv9jumBd6AfrZ4BboXRH7II9mk1IZjPEybGmsxyISN6UBzy2c6N-0kLq2ChsvQSbX9csKsub-J4-JIZg==) highlights that investors cheered news of a trade agreement with the U.K. and suggestions of more deals to come. Additionally, upcoming trade talks between the U.S. and Chinese officials in Switzerland this weekend are viewed positively by investors, particularly for companies like Tesla with significant exposure to the Chinese market, as reported by [The Motley Fool](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXFLIxLMj2dHyIUPVbIB2J46bcm_ZZ6xnlFN45tR_6s2Ew-0pw_UDj4bMQ5b0PgaUPtzm5VWsaz0Y8dQd5z5jWQwl24nv_ZZVkG5TFO7Z319wivsLpdqZdXKUnXjVXWcWMD9cKdaRpCmJ_wAXFNC3T6AVcWaIszgUjGxKAWAotQu5wfRfqxpIfkWDmXY8yfU-2Cp). Despite the recent gains, Tesla's shares remain down nearly 25% since the beginning of the year.

The increase in stock price comes despite recent challenges, including a downbeat start to the week following reports of declining sales and registrations in several European countries and China. According to [CEO Today](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHQGgNR4Z3QB6mT14lIqhFfNDJwEDp9QQfya3A7Y2dwBNm20FrJPR4Axk7LXsFK8xOBh0XGY7K69fIfaECjwtLpOnsXbJd2bpaxId_E6qJzuhf-OzJ5t0cx31-tZgw0dqkwWj6GOB9jvn_6MvJZHjkooYqTnpdapnR_y2GJkLuqDXeEuNPhv15Z_J76Vauu0yBxehrG7EzsTYe4jPORxrI6dkZgzUTM), Tesla's stock in the United States has seen a 13% decline in 2025, attributed to concerns over slowing deliveries and increased competition. European sales in Q1 2025 reportedly dropped 38% compared to the previous year, while in China, recent data indicates a 6.67% drop in weekly registrations. Competition from local manufacturers in China, such as BYD, is cited as a factor impacting Tesla's sales there.

### Gigafactory Shanghai Achieves Production Milestone

Tesla's Gigafactory Shanghai has achieved a new production record by completing the capacity ramp-up for the updated Model Y in just six weeks. [Teslarati](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHT6ZEPXR9GT3SSwZld0OWj9davj0JGaVX3yewlmtFnCwIHjEM2vM-TKtAzHUil-ZbJ391zl2eXQ6J1Rz_sJLQpGgrU5Atu9QuKbHB1ec7zUKrig7txZmPi4C2BUez61OScS7tSG6jI5_epedUsWAD0QhQ-sA==) and [CnEVPost](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXF0B3MJSUSS51v99Np-EkIHltXhx6bOXg6PM3nMgASb-uoniT1124kSrrdk0ZY7syb-shcoCYhSmJSXWfl8MZ5_4GzdLgkL-IVvdXcCNShEeRKPDlPI3FXUN74kQO9KFc-UGIWTaYKJD2ZEWiYJmfqN46E_XnyS5jJOZWx_g02C4m9hP7AGbA==) report that Tesla China announced this achievement on the social media platform Weibo, highlighting it as the fastest model production ramp-up in the company's history. This rapid ramp-up demonstrates Tesla's refined production processes and enhanced automation, building on lessons learned from previous production challenges, such as those experienced during the Model 3 launch, according to [Drive Tesla Canada](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXGJ6bfByaTv8AGlVHfdCwtpGMhocs2AZV7NS_EfbKh6mX_dd9bo2NK7QOLPCf5FyemSAuQ8jHlxEVJUhNYi3joih3wUw89FCuLZXmRWedlajjxkMmL6h45m8KnY0vcTgMV1aGaMFhyQY0tPYQbOXj5bMlsPQkLRYh_auDQSU9q9gfKdLl3dEF-6Y_PbANZuusxcMCbRVkHceQ==).

The updated Model Y, which is now being delivered to customers globally, began production at Gigafactory Shanghai on February 18, following its launch in China on January 10, [CnEVPost](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXF0B3MJSUSS51v99Np-EkIHltXhx6bOXg6PM3nMgASb-uoniT1124kSrrdk0ZY7syb-shcoCYhSmJSXWfl8MZ5_4GzdLgkL-IVvdXcCNShEeRKPDlPI3FXUN74kQO9KFc-UGIWTaYKJD2ZEWiYJmfqN46E_XnyS5jJOZWx_g02C4m9hP7AGbA==) reports. Deliveries in China commenced on February 26. Despite this production efficiency, the Model Y's appeal in China has reportedly declined due to increased competition from local rivals. To address this, Tesla is offering a five-year zero-interest financing plan for Model Y purchases in China until June 30. There are also rumors of a potential three-row, extended wheelbase Model Y entering production at Gigafactory Shanghai this month, and a lower-priced Model Y variant in 2026, according to [CnEVPost](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXF0B3MJSUSS51v99Np-EkIHltXhx6bOXg6PM3nMgASb-uoniT1124kSrrdk0ZY7syb-shcoCYhSmJSXWfl8MZ5_4GzdLgkL-IVvdXcCNShEeRKPDlPI3FXUN74kQO9KFc-UGIWTaYKJD2ZEWiYJmfqN46E_XnyS5jJOZWx_g02C4m9hP7AGBw==) and [The Driven](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXGQHiMF9xK1cUplxnZrg5cXptfvoCU7Gl6CGS8nl9BfQHj6G_Dl9lu7_DPce9VGFoLyVU47DZLck_u04JXsl-yJde2wn2Q2aG6CnYxY5F7glN2DJI4XauWMravNxXHhvxdvV1z-k9d-vJaR5VPC6Bv7tptxp-_q2nlyUM70yXanO3SbI7x06hKCHhngnKsEqz6DJJAuHnFUIhJOczdq_3ZEng==).

### Robotaxi and Autonomous Driving Development

Tesla continues to emphasize its focus on autonomous driving technology and the planned launch of its robotaxi service. According to [Investopedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHpLOrkLW7iIVULInrjCqzY-17lxw4A6zSHo7DyDFxF-kBtC2NWcNKczBtTm1QnuxSVdghgJryKR65ycphymUOvPVrfN9i8ZW_O-J6vTVS4Sk2b6Da99BsymNEnMpkWb49Suwsv9jumBd6AfrZ4BboXRH7II9mk1IZjPEybGmsxyISN6UBzy2c6N-0kLq2ChsvQSbX9csKsub-J4-JIZg==), investors are anticipating updates on the company's plans to begin offering paid robotaxi rides in Model Y vehicles in Austin, Texas, by the end of next month. [moomoo Community](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXGXUx02vzJexU3p2y_fs8jTBl1d3V625P3k5o0hK18f75a9kLQ8rL8ZvAN-GjFsLWtsG9quAZ9vyGtFxj5cVIFdfFYpv62AqkPxwnTFRWfy5M6Nj5VpBRD4HfgAvzBTrtmvUOadW-jS6Ahmdw==) highlights that Elon Musk has indicated the robotaxi service, utilizing Tesla's "unsupervised" Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology, is less than a month away from launching in Austin. The initial fleet is expected to consist of Model 3 and Model Y vehicles, with booking available through a mobile app.

Tesla views its expanding AI and Energy Solutions as key long-term growth drivers. The company has stated that its Model 3, Model Y, and Cybertruck vehicles at its U.S. factories can autonomously drive from the production line to the outbound logistics lot without human supervision. During the Q1 earnings call, Musk reportedly stated his intention to allocate significantly more time to Tesla, focusing on autonomy, AI, and affordable vehicle platforms, a move welcomed by investors according to [24/7 Wall St.](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXFoO4iOXpdaCdO-3p6m4KBEMG1Wrckd5qUvirlBEbmBQVrL2TA4QfOxcnuOvv1QkgElIFvYL_E809a3L-72YYppc3Jf3aAHLoXSrIrnqPXzBfsNvNvGkOdjUxeIJnWtxzIKWFnyJ1jrDpO2doA-kzEMYBRSDIOvFswHaKCqLF0zRAPaBJUF7om_8Qj-6mHf4764xy07--TyxHkjrw==). This increased focus on Tesla follows Musk's previous engagement with government matters.

### Production and Delivery Updates

Beyond the record ramp-up in Shanghai, Tesla continues to refine its production processes and vehicle offerings. The company is expected to improve the output of its factories with future vehicles, with plans for "ultra-high levels of automation" on the Cybercab production line in North America, aiming for a production rate of one vehicle every five seconds, as noted by [Teslarati](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHT6ZEPXR9GT3SSwZld0OWj9davj0JGaVX3yewlmtFnCwIHjEM2vM-TKtAzHUil-ZbJ391zl2eXQ6J1Rz_sJLQpGgrU5Atu9QuKbHB1ec7zUKrig7txZmPi4C2BUez61OScS7tSG6jI5_epedUsWAD0QhQ-sA==). [CnEVPost](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXF0B3MJSUSS51v99Np-EkIHltXhx6bOXg6PM3nMgASb-uoniT1124kSrrdk0ZY7syb-shcoCYhSmJSXWfl8MZ5_4GzdLgkL-IVvdXcCNShEeRKPDlPI3FXUN74kQO9KFc-UGIWTaYKJD2ZEWiYJmfqN46E_XnyS5jJOZWx_g02C4m9hP7AGBw==) also reported this target for the North American factory. Tesla currently operates four vehicle factories globally.

In terms of deliveries, Tesla delivered 58,459 vehicles from Gigafactory Shanghai in April 2025, a 6% decrease compared to April 2024 and a 25.8% drop from March 2025, according to data from the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) reported by [Drive Tesla Canada](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHQCpS1QVAE7lbzs3ki2RpEggogJxfBEP3S-HaQTqwuYo_mZMc1gA_znaZfQBErhO5PfErm8QisHTRJ7IQLkxocOEJKeqprWY5D_2VXFq-fVR4ySVaa6xCFtuBo2ojeiBFExIiCxzxdRP0vSTbEBD9m0-GaJpY8pHhaP0SD8LkbqCMFSk3Ti8DN27uDlC4=). This figure includes both domestic sales and exports. Year-to-date deliveries from Shanghai are down 18.3% compared to the same period in 2024. The recent shipment of 3500 updated Model Y vehicles to New South Wales, Australia, is expected to boost sales there and help Tesla regain market share.

Tesla also recently launched the refreshed Model Y Long Range Rear Wheel Drive in the United States, offering a more affordable option with longer range, as reported by [Tesla North](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXFHviB4IWzpGC3l63riaXsXKvmnGd9uq-wLT5Ckx2zKiKfe4tqXuOUPgEp7Ab7nbbYI534X1ONeE84bcXulzTA__y5CbWd3hT82BRfU8cUZdPhATQ==). Additionally, an Acceleration Boost software update is now available for owners of the new Model Y refresh in the U.S. for a price of $2,000.

### Other Developments

Mazda has announced that it will adopt the North American Charging Standard (NACS), also known as Tesla's charge connector, for its battery electric vehicles launched in Japan from 2027 onward. This agreement will grant Mazda EV owners in Japan access to Tesla's Supercharger network, according to [Electrek](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXFeu-Qooy6QcHn4aDhb47f4qAz0amQ9VIhYi5z1wLDVPGF60NXVKooZ_NY0ECREd119-mpUgXulOSZWQTnJnhhvx94GTTMEiBNEajMF3dJVxz2OhwFez9rauLGIBEEEHBrgJEbDVvcMS1LdZMV_K6HLNsUzx_DkA3O-yZz0uhw==). This follows Mazda's earlier announcement to adopt NACS for its EVs in North America.

In a separate development, shareholders on social media reportedly mistook a prototype vehicle from competitor Faraday Future (FF) for a Tesla prototype, according to [Electrek](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXG7mog5gAoQuzZsXgCrijYRT50XSBSnhi4UErZzmMY-mO1aEDwr4YknYiKmPOJgvw29ObEaTa10BhllpTzke27yi1uhK8muBAeQCYOfBIZNmbDqiZUV5y3CWwvV2aaoQDvnGuQV5JPRRQn7qtHyWCnn9DzUUrtWZ_Z8hwE665sS4S5oQcsGNO4G8mjBRdZgKMKcERt_BdR-xDqd). Faraday Future confirmed the vehicle was a prototype mule of their new 'Faraday X'. This incident is seen by some as an example of some Tesla shareholders not fully recognizing the company's challenges and accepting information without verification.

Texas has put forward a bill that would impose new restrictions on shareholder eligibility for submitting proposals, potentially limiting the influence of small investors, as reported by [Minerva-Manifest](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXHPk0kSp9AxOK4nCaolWAipFkSR7BourX54u5YJNc6IURfkUfSN8IZd7HGOc0qol9CXeXOoiXu7xzQPcPE8p0ZSPH_Wm84lz_1vH67ZQjBscofuoTtiEnflF6UYwUVbr-i8IvQACvYA3zcQT2kgrqIE8m-EzERD410GNecC-5gGf2Rs-w63sOwG1_serIF7). The bill, which passed 45 to 5, includes requirements such as owning $1 million or 3% of voting stock, a holding period of at least six months, and the solicitation of 67% of shareholders for a proposal to appear on the proxy. This bill could potentially allow companies like Tesla, which have not yet filed their proxies, to block small shareholder proposals.

Tesla's Bitcoin holdings were noted in recent earnings reports to be worth approximately $1.1 billion, holding 11,509 Bitcoins. The value on the balance sheet increased significantly due to changes in accounting rules at the end of Q4 2024.

**Regarding production in China, [IOL](https**//vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AbF9wXGbRBIC9epYSwUB_uSlE2E2g-VlHqwopN5-jntcjNn_icPi8hQoUikmZAWIPJ2_7Hvr5wiM2Bnmfx18cPHHIIgB8iJTrecd5lc80VEfkjLvPH-E_qVd5zke1EQ11arG0Nqiqy-mZjrgqZhltTRt01Xs9UVc) reported that Tesla was added to a government list of approved automotive manufacturers in China, granting the necessary certificate to begin production in the country. While Reuters had reported earlier in the month that production was planned to start in May, uncertainties around orders, labor, and suppliers could impact when year-end targets are met. Tesla aims to produce at least 1,000 Model 3s per week from the Shanghai factory by the end of the year to boost sales and avoid higher import tariffs on U.S. cars.
